abstract.para: Describes how to build the push messaging-enabled &AMHlong; quickstart app in Android Studio.

section.title: Build a Push Messaging-Enabled &AMHlong; App for Android
section.para: This topic describes how to import and build the &AMHlong; quickstart code in Android Studio. We assume that you have already generated the quickstart app code using the &AMHlong; console, and downloaded the code in a zip file to your computer.

step.para: Unzip the zip file that &AMHlong; provided.
Open Android Studio and choose Import project (Eclipse ADT, Gradle, etc.).
Open the folder where you extracted the zip file contents and choose the MySampleApp folder.
Android Studio will import the project and build it using Gradle.
If a dialog box appears recommending that you update your Gradle Plug-in, choose Don't remind me again for this project.

section.para: After the build completes, you can install and run the app on a physical or virtual Android device.
